Then wrought<S>6213</S> Bezaleel<S>1212</S> and Aholiab<S>171</S>, and every wise<S>2450</S> hearted<S>3820</S> man<S>376</S>, in whom<S>1992</S> the LORD<S>3068</S> put<S>5414</S> wisdom<S>2451</S> and understanding<S>8394</S> to know<S>3045</S> how to work<S>6213</S> all manner of work<S>4399</S> for the service<S>5656</S> of the sanctuary<S>6944</S>, according to all that the LORD<S>3068</S> had commanded<S>6680</S>.
And Moses<S>4872</S> called<S>7121</S> Bezaleel<S>1212</S> and Aholiab<S>171</S>, and every wise<S>2450</S> hearted<S>3820</S> man<S>376</S>, in whose heart<S>3820</S> the LORD<S>3068</S> had put<S>5414</S> wisdom<S>2451</S>, even every one whose heart<S>3820</S> stirred him up<S>5375</S> to come<S>7126</S> unto the work<S>4399</S> to do<S>6213</S> it:
And they received<S>3947</S> of<S>6440</S> Moses<S>4872</S> all the offering<S>8641</S>, which the children<S>1121</S> of Israel<S>3478</S> had brought<S>935</S> for the work<S>4399</S> of the service<S>5656</S> of the sanctuary<S>6944</S>, to make<S>6213</S> it withal. And they brought<S>935</S> yet unto him free offerings<S>5071</S> every morning<S>1242</S>.
And all the wise men<S>2450</S>, that wrought<S>6213</S> all the work<S>4399</S> of the sanctuary<S>6944</S>, came<S>935</S> every man<S>376</S> from his work<S>4399</S> which they made<S>6213</S>;
And they spake<S>559</S> unto Moses<S>4872</S>, saying<S>559</S>, The people<S>5971</S> bring<S>935</S> much more<S>7235</S> than enough<S>1767</S> for the service<S>5656</S> of the work<S>4399</S>, which the LORD<S>3068</S> commanded<S>6680</S> to make<S>6213</S>.
And Moses<S>4872</S> gave commandment<S>6680</S>, and they caused it to be proclaimed<S>6963</S> <S>5674</S> throughout the camp<S>4264</S>, saying<S>559</S>, Let neither man<S>376</S> nor woman<S>802</S> make<S>6213</S> any more work<S>4399</S> for the offering<S>8641</S> of the sanctuary<S>6944</S>. So the people<S>5971</S> were restrained<S>3607</S> from bringing<S>935</S>.
For the stuff<S>4399</S> they had was sufficient<S>1767</S> for all the work<S>4399</S> to make<S>6213</S> it, and too much<S>3498</S>.
And every wise<S>2450</S> hearted man<S>3820</S> among them that wrought<S>6213</S> the work<S>4399</S> of the tabernacle<S>4908</S> made<S>6213</S> ten<S>6235</S> curtains<S>3407</S> of fine twined<S>7806</S> linen<S>8336</S>, and blue<S>8504</S>, and purple<S>713</S>, and scarlet<S>8144</S> <S>8438</S>: with cherubims<S>3742</S> of cunning<S>2803</S> work<S>4639</S> made<S>6213</S> he them.
The length<S>753</S> of one<S>259</S> curtain<S>3407</S> was twenty<S>6242</S> and eight<S>8083</S> cubits<S>520</S>, and the breadth<S>7341</S> of one<S>259</S> curtain<S>3407</S> four<S>702</S> cubits<S>520</S>: the curtains<S>3407</S> were all of one<S>259</S> size<S>4060</S>.
And he coupled<S>2266</S> the five<S>2568</S> curtains<S>3407</S> one<S>259</S> unto another<S>259</S>: and the other five<S>2568</S> curtains<S>3407</S> he coupled<S>2266</S> one<S>259</S> unto another<S>259</S>.
And he made<S>6213</S> loops<S>3924</S> of blue<S>8504</S> on the edge<S>8193</S> of one<S>259</S> curtain<S>3407</S> from the selvedge<S>7098</S> in the coupling<S>4225</S>: likewise he made<S>6213</S> in the uttermost<S>7020</S> side<S>8193</S> of another curtain<S>3407</S>, in the coupling<S>4225</S> of the second<S>8145</S>.
Fifty<S>2572</S> loops<S>3924</S> made<S>6213</S> he in one<S>259</S> curtain<S>3407</S>, and fifty<S>2572</S> loops<S>3924</S> made<S>6213</S> he in the edge<S>7097</S> of the curtain<S>3407</S> which was in the coupling<S>4225</S> of the second<S>8145</S>: the loops<S>3924</S> held<S>6901</S> one<S>259</S> curtain to another<S>259</S>.
And he made<S>6213</S> fifty<S>2572</S> taches<S>7165</S> of gold<S>2091</S>, and coupled<S>2266</S> the curtains<S>3407</S> one<S>259</S> unto another<S>259</S> with the taches<S>7165</S>: so it became one<S>259</S> tabernacle<S>4908</S>.
And he made<S>6213</S> curtains<S>3407</S> of goats'<S>5795</S> hair for the tent<S>168</S> over the tabernacle<S>4908</S>: eleven<S>6249</S> <S>6240</S> curtains<S>3407</S> he made<S>6213</S> them.
The length<S>753</S> of one<S>259</S> curtain<S>3407</S> was thirty<S>7970</S> cubits<S>520</S>, and four<S>702</S> cubits<S>520</S> was the breadth<S>7341</S> of one<S>259</S> curtain<S>3407</S>: the eleven<S>6249</S> <S>6240</S> curtains<S>3407</S> were of one<S>259</S> size<S>4060</S>.
And he coupled<S>2266</S> five<S>2568</S> curtains<S>3407</S> by themselves, and six<S>8337</S> curtains<S>3407</S> by themselves.
And he made<S>6213</S> fifty<S>2572</S> loops<S>3924</S> upon the uttermost<S>7020</S> edge<S>8193</S> of the curtain<S>3407</S> in the coupling<S>4225</S>, and fifty<S>2572</S> loops<S>3924</S> made<S>6213</S> he upon the edge<S>8193</S> of the curtain<S>3407</S> which coupleth<S>2279</S> the second<S>8145</S>.
And he made<S>6213</S> fifty<S>2572</S> taches<S>7165</S> of brass<S>5178</S> to couple<S>2266</S> the tent<S>168</S> together<S>2266</S>, that it might be one<S>259</S>.
And he made<S>6213</S> a covering<S>4372</S> for the tent<S>168</S> of rams'<S>352</S> skins<S>5785</S> dyed red<S>119</S>, and a covering<S>4372</S> of badgers'<S>8476</S> skins<S>5785</S> above<S>4605</S> that.
And he made<S>6213</S> boards<S>7175</S> for the tabernacle<S>4908</S> of shittim<S>7848</S> wood<S>6086</S>, standing up<S>5975</S>.
The length<S>753</S> of a board<S>7175</S> was ten<S>6235</S> cubits<S>520</S>, and the breadth<S>7341</S> of a board<S>7175</S> one<S>259</S> cubit<S>520</S> and a half<S>2677</S>.
One<S>259</S> board<S>7175</S> had two<S>8147</S> tenons<S>3027</S>, equally distant<S>7947</S> one<S>259</S> from<S>413</S> another<S>259</S>: thus did he make<S>6213</S> for all the boards<S>7175</S> of the tabernacle<S>4908</S>.
And he made<S>6213</S> boards<S>7175</S> for the tabernacle<S>4908</S>; twenty<S>6242</S> boards<S>7175</S> for the south<S>5045</S> side<S>6285</S> southward<S>8486</S>:
And forty<S>705</S> sockets<S>134</S> of silver<S>3701</S> he made<S>6213</S> under the twenty<S>6242</S> boards<S>7175</S>; two<S>8147</S> sockets<S>134</S> under one<S>259</S> board<S>7175</S> for his two<S>8147</S> tenons<S>3027</S>, and two<S>8147</S> sockets<S>134</S> under another<S>259</S> board<S>7175</S> for his two<S>8147</S> tenons<S>3027</S>.
And for the other<S>8145</S> side<S>6763</S> of the tabernacle<S>4908</S>, which is toward the north<S>6828</S> corner<S>6285</S>, he made<S>6213</S> twenty<S>6242</S> boards<S>7175</S>,
And their forty<S>705</S> sockets<S>134</S> of silver<S>3701</S>; two<S>8147</S> sockets<S>134</S> under one<S>259</S> board<S>7175</S>, and two<S>8147</S> sockets<S>134</S> under another<S>259</S> board<S>7175</S>.
And for the sides<S>3411</S> of the tabernacle<S>4908</S> westward<S>3220</S> he made<S>6213</S> six<S>8337</S> boards<S>7175</S>.
And two<S>8147</S> boards<S>7175</S> made<S>6213</S> he for the corners<S>4742</S> of the tabernacle<S>4908</S> in the two sides<S>3411</S>.
And they were coupled<S>8382</S> beneath<S>4295</S>, and coupled<S>8382</S> together<S>3162</S> at the head<S>7218</S> thereof, to one<S>259</S> ring<S>2885</S>: thus he did<S>6213</S> to both<S>8147</S> of them in both<S>8147</S> the corners<S>4740</S>. <sup>coupled: Heb. twinned</sup>
And there were eight<S>8083</S> boards<S>7175</S>; and their sockets<S>134</S> were sixteen<S>8337</S> <S>6240</S> sockets<S>134</S> of silver<S>3701</S>, under every<S>259</S> board<S>7175</S> two<S>8147</S> <S>8147</S> sockets<S>134</S> <S>134</S>. <sup>under: Heb. two sockets, two sockets under one board</sup>
And he made<S>6213</S> bars<S>1280</S> of shittim<S>7848</S> wood<S>6086</S>; five<S>2568</S> for the boards<S>7175</S> of the one<S>259</S> side<S>6763</S> of the tabernacle<S>4908</S>,
And five<S>2568</S> bars<S>1280</S> for the boards<S>7175</S> of the other<S>8145</S> side<S>6763</S> of the tabernacle<S>4908</S>, and five<S>2568</S> bars<S>1280</S> for the boards<S>7175</S> of the tabernacle<S>4908</S> for the sides<S>3411</S> westward<S>3220</S>.
And he made<S>6213</S> the middle<S>8484</S> bar<S>1280</S> to shoot<S>1272</S> through<S>8432</S> the boards<S>7175</S> from the one end<S>7097</S> to the other<S>7097</S>.
And he overlaid<S>6823</S> the boards<S>7175</S> with gold<S>2091</S>, and made<S>6213</S> their rings<S>2885</S> of gold<S>2091</S> to be places<S>1004</S> for the bars<S>1280</S>, and overlaid<S>6823</S> the bars<S>1280</S> with gold<S>2091</S>.
And he made<S>6213</S> a vail<S>6532</S> of blue<S>8504</S>, and purple<S>713</S>, and scarlet<S>8144</S> <S>8438</S>, and fine twined<S>7806</S> linen<S>8336</S>: with cherubims<S>3742</S> made<S>6213</S> he it of cunning<S>2803</S> work<S>4639</S>.
And he made<S>6213</S> thereunto four<S>702</S> pillars<S>5982</S> of shittim<S>7848</S> wood, and overlaid<S>6823</S> them with gold<S>2091</S>: their hooks<S>2053</S> were of gold<S>2091</S>; and he cast<S>3332</S> for them four<S>702</S> sockets<S>134</S> of silver<S>3701</S>.
And he made<S>6213</S> an hanging<S>4539</S> for the tabernacle<S>168</S> door<S>6607</S> of blue<S>8504</S>, and purple<S>713</S>, and scarlet<S>8144</S> <S>8438</S>, and fine twined<S>7806</S> linen<S>8336</S>, of needlework<S>7551</S> <S>4639</S>; <sup>of needlework: Heb. the work of a needleworker or, embroiderer</sup>
And the five<S>2568</S> pillars<S>5982</S> of it with their hooks<S>2053</S>: and he overlaid<S>6823</S> their chapiters<S>7218</S> and their fillets<S>2838</S> with gold<S>2091</S>: but their five<S>2568</S> sockets<S>134</S> were of brass<S>5178</S>.
